Reviews.Title: Item is not liked described and does not come unlocked.
Reviews.Author: Ryan Burnett "King-of-all qPCR"
Reviews.Content: Item is titled as an unloced wireless 3G internet card.  However, when installation was attempted it promptly lets you know that it is locked to ATT.  This is useless for an overseas carrier.  Unfortunately, I found this out while travelling and was not able to return it when I returned due to the short return policy.  In addition, item came packed loose in an ATT box.  It seemed as if it was a refurbished item due to its lack of packaging and information.  I know that this is not technically a review, because I haven't actually been able to use the item.  I was hoping this would work for my needs.  Maybe I'll sell it in the marketplace so that someone else can give it a try.

Reviews.Title: It Works!  But...
Reviews.Author: Lisa A. Simon "L.A. Simon"
Reviews.Content: I'm using this with my IPhone sim card.  I installed it as directed, but it wouldn't work.  There is a previous version of the software that is available.  If you download that version, it works!I was surfing at decent speeds.  This will work great when wi-fi or internet isn't available.

Reviews.Title: Speedy modem, great for sending SMS and MMS
Reviews.Author: B. Warthen
Reviews.Content: First a note related to the one-star review of this modem.  Of course, you need service with a mobile operator (AT&T; or T-Mobile in the US ... although you'll only get EDGE speeds on T-Mobile as this modem does not support T-Mobile's 3G service on the 1700Mhz band).  You need a SIM card with an active service contract from a GSM operator to use this product.  If you don't understand this, then this product is definitely not for you.AT&T; sells this product locked to their service as the USBConnect QuickSilver.The Option ICON 322 is a fast modem for automated sending of SMS and MMS.  I use it with the Now SMS/MMS Gateway software product (a.k.a., NowSMS).It also works great for internet access.  It's nice and compact, so it's easy to pack along with your laptop.

Reviews.Title: Fine Replacement
Reviews.Author: pbcguy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a replacement item for the wireless 3G Internet card I accidentally dropped on the floor. I need to add that this is an exact replacement - make, model and manufacturer, even down to being branded AT&T; - of what I dropped and that I did not drop the original from a high height on to a concrete slab; it was dropped from table height on to a wooden floor where it snapped apart. The device is made to snap apart but when I put it together, it no longer worked. What I am saying is that while the device may look durable, it is in fact quite fragile.Not knowing where else to turn, I went to my service provider AT&T; and was definitely not satisfied with their options. Since my card was "out of warranty," they would gladly give me a new one for "free" if I renewed my contract for another two years - the service isn't all that great, but that's another review - or they would sell me a new one for - hold your hats, folks - $249! Neither option was acceptable.Fortunately, I had saved my old PCMCIA card. I took my broken card home with me, put the SIM card into the PCMCIA card, went online and found this card - unlocked yet! - at Amazon for under $30 and received it in under four days. It probably would have been sooner but there was a weekend in between. What's wrong with this picture that AT&T; was so willing to sell me a replacement at $249 while it was less than $30 on Amazon? As for ease of set up, there was no more difficulty than inserting the SIM card into a slot. The SIM card will go in only one way but make sure you have it right side up and don't force it.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to configure
Reviews.Author: ARASAN4
Reviews.Content: I bought this product because my previous 3G modem is broken.I plugged the new modem, a software was automatically installed, and I made the configuration taking into consideration the other modem configuration. After 5 minutes I was connected again.My internet provider is not AT&T; that was not a problem, there are several options which include AT&T; connections and others, so it is really unlocked.

Reviews.Title: Almost plug and play
Reviews.Author: PaulaJava "PaulaJava"
Reviews.Content: It was a little bit of brian power to get the thing going with a TMo sim card. Even though I have TMo's web light which is supposed to be 3G I only got Edge. This was slow and I couldn't stream anything. I actually had to subscribe to Cox which I really didn't want to do. It's great for using it on the road to check email. I'd buy it again if I had to. I do like that the drivers and software is in the device. I did an uninstall of AT&T;'s connection manager thinking I could reinstall it. It never did so I went to Options website and got the software from there. So all in all it's a good product.

Reviews.Title: Limited Data Plan Options
Reviews.Author: BillyB1951
Reviews.Content: I was hoping that this product could be used in conjunction with popular Data Plans that are becoming available - NOT.  Verizon doesn't even accept this product and AT&T; and Sprint only recognize it as an Air Card option and have the flat rate ranging from $35 to $50 a month. Will keep it but wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Icon 322 USB
Reviews.Author: Steve G
Reviews.Content: I bought this item because I wanted to play Xbox live, but the only problem is that I live out in the country of California and we don't get DSL or cable. I decided to do a little research on cell phone internet. I purchased the Icon 322 and net gear 3g wireless router. Both of the units are needed if you want to play Xbox live, but if you just want the internet for your computer you can just buy the Icon 322.The Icon 322 did need a little brain power to set up on your computer.  After the Icon 322 and Net Gear wireless 3g router were hooked up my internet speed was at T-1 connection.Well it's now March 24 about three months of having the icon 322 and what's funny is that AT&T; found out that I keep swapping my sim cards from my phone to the icon 322 usb, turns out they don't allow that. They restricted my internet on my lg Shine phone and whats worse Them M/F wanted to charge me a air card fee. So the item does work, the only problem is AT&T; will found out and restrict your internet.

Reviews.Title: Useless and a waste of money
Reviews.Author: Diomedes Ignacio Domínguez Ureña
Reviews.Content: I have to buy the same item from some guy in eBay later I bought this one, because the first one don't work.

Reviews.Title: from other reviews, I think I need to do something than just plug and go
Reviews.Author: ybot
Reviews.Content: I am researching to see if there is something else I have to do, or download something, I put it into my computer and nothing. Was hoping it would just start to download.

Reviews.Title: ICON322
Reviews.Author: Tech2010
Reviews.Content: I received this product in time. you need to download driver and software from company website.I tried two sims ( AT&T; and T Mobile ) and all they worked in the sense of connectivity but I haven't tried internet connection.  I want to take it to INDIA and check with Airtel sim card.Overall good quality product.

Reviews.Title: good option
Reviews.Author: Scotta
Reviews.Content: It works as advertised, although it runs a little hot and crashed my Macbook pro.  Under windows i never had any problems.

Reviews.Title: Good product with some issues
Reviews.Author: Roberto Suarez "Attorney"
Reviews.Content: Works fine.  The only issues are: gets very warm (I dont know if is normal because I only have use this), have not been able to use it and set it up in my Mac. Prices is great and the product works great with windows and my Netgear router.

Reviews.Title: You might need a paper clip to click the SIM into position
Reviews.Author: Rob Rosenberger
Reviews.Content: Overall: a handy little device with easy setup.  Works like a champ.  I recommend it.[...] customers -- this device does NOT support your new 3G network.  You want the Option iCON 452 instead.However, I don't see anywhere in the instructions where the SIM must actually click into position "like a Bic pen."  None of my devices up to this point have used this technique to seat the SIM.  I couldn't use a fingertip to get it to click, and I couldn't get it to recognize the SIM, so I finally called Option's support line.  Two minutes later, a tech told me to use a paper clip to do what my fingertip could not.  Problem solved!

Reviews.Title: Doesn't Work At All.
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: The unit seems to be locked to AT&T;, it has an AT&T; connection manager that can't be disabled and loads when the unit is plugged in. Even though I installed the software from Option it still won't connect with T-Mobile. In fact the thing doesn't pick up any wireless services at all so I don't think it even works. Also it kept asking me for a PIN which I don't have. A Zoom Model 4597 works fine on the same laptop with the same SIM card.

Reviews.Title: It fits the bill
Reviews.Author: Macau Lok "techgeeck"
Reviews.Content: I got this for couple of weeks. it was in the expectation at this price. The set up is a smooth ride. I used AT&T; SIM card from my iPhone. The connection site will be WAP.CINGULAR and leave rest of the field blank.The speed icon shows 600K connection but the real test shows 2.7/download/Max, 1.0M/upload/Max. Some reviewer complains of over heating but I think it was in a reasonable range after using it for 2-3 hours. Don't use AT&T; wireless manager for connection. Use original software that could be download from manufacturer's website. It dose not work with Zoom 3G router even though Zoom claims it dose. Overall, it fits the bill. With free shipping at Amazon, it even better than my deal.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work.
Reviews.Author: S. Ricketts
Reviews.Content: I followed all the direction to setup this device and nothing works. I tired on PC and Mac. You will have to contact AT&T;, and get the service enabled for a fee.
